Absolutely adorable but super tight in chest, could not wear because every time I breathed it unzipped:-( If you are anything bigger than an A cup size up!

This dress is so cute. I really wanted it to wear it because it looked so great from the rib cage down. It fit TTS except in the chest. Waaay too much overflow to be wearable and I really tried to make it work! If you are more than a C cup (possibly a B) this just won't work.

I am an athletic size 4 and I figured that due to European sizing, the 42 might work. I knew it wouldn't fit the minute I took it out of the bag. The dress is gorgeous- very well made and nice, thick quality denim but the size 6 was very large on me. The tips of the wings on the bodice are starting to droop over but that could be because I was swimming in it. If the 4 (or even the 2!) ever becomes available, I'm going to try again.
Amazing jacket! Super soft leather. Fit true to size for me (6/8).

I am so obsessed with this jacket. It's the softest leather, and is so pretty. Love the light pink color. Able to dress it up or down. Size up if you want a bit of a looser fit; this was very form fitting on me when zipped up. Will definitely rent again!

Loved this jacket so much. Got it to go with a dress but wore it a few times with different outfits. Can dress up or down. Nice and warm, I will admit, the "sandy" name of the jacket threw me... I thought it was going to be a sand color... it was light pink which I saw clearly in the first sentence of the description. Highly recommend, will rent again.
Great jacket. Versatile. I have longs arms and torso and it was a good fit.
IMO this runs larger than other Mackage leather jackets. it is beautiful however. i wish i ordered a size smaller.

Loved this sweater, feels heavy on the hanger but light when worn. The folded cuffs and slit are very cute. I have a long torso - so def recommend undershirt and/or high waisted bottoms with this one.

Immediately when I tried this on I was obsessed. It's such a great weight and a staple that I would argue everyone needs in their closet. The only thing that I didn't love was the one sided cut out. I know that it's supposed to be "the look" but I personally just thought it was awkward and it would've been better if both sides had the slit. If you plan on wearing this to work like I did then you should plan on an undershirt or with high waisted pants!
Love the little slit on the side, gives it a bit of an edge. Super comfy & cozy but still looks chic for work. I would buy this in a second if it weren't so $$$!

This sweater was thick and kept me warm even without a jacket. It felt nice on. The material didn't make me itch. It was comfortable and is super cute with jeans, skirts and even shorts. This would be my go to sweater for the fall.
Body, structure, color all really great! However, this piece feels very over worn.

links_reviews_title: This is an effortlessly cool sweater!
links_reviews_text: Loved wearing this! The shape is nice & boxy plus it hangs beautifully. I liked the large sleeves and mock neck- cozy without being overpowering. Wore several times to brunch, work meetings, etc and could easily dress it up or down. I have a long torso and it didn't run short.

links_reviews_title: Wore this with a pencil skirt and stilettos for work. Chic but relaxed. Looooove the sweater.
links_reviews_text: Never want to return this. So cozy. The slit adds just enough interest so that it's not boring.
Way too oversized for my height - the sleeves came down past my hands

links_reviews_title: great material - keeps you warm without overheating - neckline is flattering
links_reviews_text: Cons - sleeves are very long and need to be folded - can feel heavy
The slit goes up kind of high though so you could see my side when worn with jeans
Love the slightly oversized fit. This sweater feels heavy and warm and was perfect for January in NYC.
Fits oversize and boxy! Has a cute slit on the side so make sure you wear high waisetd pants if you are wearing to work. Very thick and warm!
This sweater is really comfortable and cute, the slit isn't too high and looks great w a high waisted pair of jeans
Cute sweater! Very thick! Also has a little slit on the side hip which gives it a pop of sexy (but just a pop)
I am all about cute and comfy and this hits the nail on the head!
Cute sweater for everyday wear, some pilling of the material but not unexpected for a sweater of this nature.

links_reviews_title: Great sweater - for work or casual
links_reviews_text: I loved this sweater, it's thick and warm. It's classy enough to wear to work or you can make it casual too. I got lots of compliments on it.
Paired well with thicker pants and heels for work.
Really lovely sweater. Fit perfectly On heavy side but I wore a tank under so I could take off when I got hot

I liked this sweater. You can tell it's really nice quality from the fabric to the fit. My only complaint is that the slit on the side makes it difficult to do a front tuck with. I'm 5'2 and like to tuck in my sweaters in the front a bit to give me shape and you can't really do that with this sweater.
This sweater was nothing special, but that's why I liked it! It went with everything, and was great for work or just lounging around on the weekend. It's a good, heavier weight for fall/winter.
A heavy sweater on the hanger but doesn't feel heavy on. Cozy but not overly warm. Fit perfectly! Would re-rent.

links_reviews_title: Loved how warm this sweate is. I used it a lot during a recent trip to a cold destination.
links_reviews_text: The arms are big and the wrist. I had difficulty fitting this sweater comfortably under a peacoat or jacket. I recommend to use by itself.
Heavy material, perfect fit, has a slit on one side which looked great with high waisted jeans

links_reviews_title: High quality sweater with a twist.
links_reviews_text: The fabric is very thick and warm, great for cold winter days. I am 21 weeks pregnant and it hid my bump nicely. Note there is a slit on the side not shown in the pic which added a little interest. For pregnant mamas, best worn with over the bump black jeans or leggings.

I'm usually a Medium but they were out. The L still fit very well. The material is gorgeous and heavy this is such a smart sweater.. I really wish it didn't cost almost $300 because I would really love to buy it:. Who knows maybe I still will!!! I don't want to give it up

links_reviews_title: I love this sweater! Safe yet unique
links_reviews_text: I often stay sa way from sweaters and knits because I find them boxy on my apple shape especially post baby. When I put this sweater on tho- I loved it. The oversized sleeves are ridiculous but adorable and the mock neck is cute. (Careful of going out to eat in this - they are as perilous as bell sleeves ) The quality of the sweater is superb and it's heavy without feeling stuffy or itchy. Wish I could keep it forever .
I did not wear this. Sleeves were too long and sweater was very heavy. Maybe a medium would have worked. Great color and quality.
Soft, cozy, and very flattering on thinner figures.

links_reviews_title: Cute but runs short in length. Heavy luxe fabric.
links_reviews_text: Would've been a great pick but the torso length (short) was a no-go. Didn't wear. Great sweater if you're ok with shorter torso lengths. Really nice!

Loved this sweater in every way, neckline,cute hemline details, color, fit, weight of fabric...except it was itchy on my neck. I tried it a couple of times, really wanted it to work because it is such a great piece. Given the high neckline, I didn't have something to wear underneath to protect from the itching there. Sad. Loved the sweater!!
I really liked this sweater! It is very cozy. It is oversized so if you want it to be more fitted, size down. The only reason I don't give it 5 stars is that it was starting to pill a bit.
This sweater has a nice weight to it. The material is soft, not itchy, and can be worn without a coat on a fall day. I've rented multiple times

links_reviews_title: Comfortable, soft sweater. Good for work and every day wear
links_reviews_text: Loose fit with wide arms. Very soft and comfortable. Perfect with high waisted pants because the slit on the right side goes up a considerable amount but can be covered with the right pants.

These jeans are very of-the-moment - my 23-yr-old colleague told me they were cool. Not super cropped but with that wide-swingy leg, high-waist fit, and the light wash feels fresh. Fit is typical for a heavy non-stretch denim. These fit me perfectly but I have to say they were (like all jeans) heinously uncomfortable.

Even though these are very wide leg, and not the style I usually go for, I thought these were very flattering. My waist is 28 inch and the 28 fit perfectly. Order your true size. No stretch at all so beware of that. For me, perfect. They stretch out throughout the day.
A little longer than in the picture as I am short, but a great fit and I still love them.
I liked the style as a change up from my normal, but they run a little small and were stiff and uncomfortable so won't rent them again.

links_reviews_title: Super cute day in the office!
links_reviews_text: Full fit, so if you're concerned about adding the appearance of bulk you may want to pass. I loved the delicate design of the fabric and the ruffled detail and puffed sleeves elevated the wow for me! Lots of compliments! Would buy if it was in the budget!
This top is so cute! I love the ruffle at the neck, the puffy sleeves, and the flower details. It is the perfect every day white blouse with a little flair.
Great flattering top!

links_reviews_title: Super cute! Wore to brunch on the last day before COVID lock-down.
links_reviews_text: Loved the fit and billow of the top. Such a cute wear.

links_reviews_title: Good Dress For A Party/Everyday, A Bit Short If You Are Tall
links_reviews_text: I really enjoyed wearing this dress to a party. It's really quality material and awesome patterning. I must note that it's quite short. I'm 5'8.5" for context. I was glad to be with my boyfriend by my side haha. Overall a great dress, just be warned about the length!
I liked this dress - it's light, comfortable and a great length. I probably should have gone down a size. It was a bit bulky and made me look kinda wide in the middle.

links_reviews_title: This dress was perfect for daywear! It was great for weekend brunch or the beach!
links_reviews_text: Loose, flow-y fit. Great boho vibe.
Found it to be ok nothing that special. Wouldn't rent again.
Really cute and different!
Black with pink and shimmer Hearst all over. Loved this cozy and soft sweater!

links_reviews_title: Great for those with short torsos or for pairing with high waisted styles
links_reviews_text: Fun novelty sweater! As a person with a short torso I loved the "almost crop" length; the cut wasn't boxy as many shorter sweaters tend to be. Also a great fit for those with larger busts. 2 things you can't tell from the photos: the sleeves are slightly puffier at the shoulder and the red hearts are made with a sparkly yarn

This sweater was exactly the right fit on me (I have a short waist) neither too long or cropped. This sweater is cute - the print was fun without being too "little girl"-ish. It's a thick sweater, which I found to be perfect for our cold New York spring.
I was SOOOO tempted to buy but will rent again for sure. It adorable, isnt itchy. Perfect for theholiday but also if you're just a romantic at heart
Great everyday sweater. Lots of love. ;)
This is the perfect size fr me and super cute!!! Such a great 80's vibe that I can get behind!! Wish I could buy it.
Good for a casual dinner party or out and about

I couldn't love this sweater more. The fabric is perfect - warm, but not too hot, and very soft. The hearts are adorable. The red ones are sparkly. I'm wearing this sweater well after V-Day because I can! I really REALLY don't want to send it back.
Great fit!

I loved this sweater. It is perfect for Valentine's day or any day. The little red hearts have sparkles in them that you cannot see in the picture. I found that it fit me true to size and was even able to wear another top under it (it was cold) with no issues. It is a lighter sweater that is good for layering. The only thing is if you do not like things around your neck this is more of a turtleneck than a mock and I found myself yanking it a few times during the work day.

links_reviews_title: It looked so cute with jeans and overalls.
links_reviews_text: Fits true to size and is a heavy fabric so pretty warm for a sweater that isn't wool
Fitted in a flattering way I would buy it but I am not sure if I would wearing beyond Valentines
This sparkly top was cozy and cutesy. Love how it felt and looked. I felt great going out for beers and grocery shopping.

Rented this to fill out my slate for my RTR update bag. The sweater fits in the torso and shoulders, but the sleeves are huge and rolling them up doesn't help. So if you have short arms I would be wary to rent this. Material was thick but not too thick.

I felt too much like Wednesday Addams in this top (and I like a little Wednesday Addams in my look). It doesn't come with a tank or top to wear beneath FYI. Nothing wrong with it, just not my style up close and personal. Seems like it was true to size.
Very flattering, and surprisingly.. not very see through despite all the holes! Loved it so much I bought it.
Super fun and cute top. The shirt is on the looser side; however, if I size down the arm holes may have been too tight. Loved this shirt. Will rent again.

If you have any stomach pudge the shorts will ride up. There's not a long inseam so driving in the shorts was uncomfortable. However- walking around in them they were comfortable and soft in humid weather. Loved the pockets- only wore once because they were not flattering or comfortable for sitting.
I just wore this for everyday, but loved it. It doesn't have pockets and it runs big. It was too big for me, but I made it work! Fun piece for casual dress.

links_reviews_title: Tie dye pattern and relaxed fit
links_reviews_text: Love this jacket! Wanted to buy it!!!

I love the style and wash of the jacket but it was far too large and boxy. The collar was flimsy and didn't sit right on the chest / collar bone, it sort of flapped over. The pockets are also not real on this jacket, so it's not that functional.
Really cute and obvs on trend. Definitely runs big, size down! I never take a small and it fits me perfectly. I'm usually a M/L.
Fit is weird. Material is thin, and easy to wrinkle.
Beautiful dress with a 60's mod vibe. The one con - it wrinkles easily.
This dress has nice subtle detail. I found it a tad big but def didn't stop me from wearing. I added a red trench coat for a pop of color.

I rented this for work. The style is cute and forgiving. I'm usually a 2 or 4 and I went with a 2 in this style because there is plenty of room in the hips. I also liked the color a lot and felt very elegant/mature. My primary complaint is that the material wrinkled too easily.
Very big in the hips and wrinkles very easily. Cute though.

The dress is very cute and great for work. However, while the description says the length is 33", it's actually 35-36". It may not make a difference for most people, but it does for short girls like me.
Loved wearing this top. Received many compliments. The material is beautiful and it looked great with the PS black trouser.
This top is stunning!!!
Gorgeous top. Unusual design.

Arrived badly needing to be pressed, especially the cowl collar. Surprised (especially at this retail price) that it's not silk. Heavy fabric and that dips long in the front. The fabric is a mix of colors- black, chocolate brown, cream, safety orange, saffron, with a heavy cream and chocolate brown border. Probably best with black. Not sure how to style it- will have to play with this one a bit. Sort of "meh" for me.

Super cute blazer. It was supposed to come with a wrap belt but when I received it, the belt was missing so I improvised with my own! I could have sized down as this is oversized as is. Got a lot of compliments on this look!
I really liked this jacket but it runs very large. The extra small was enormous on me. I wore it to work but I looked like I was wearing a bathrobe.

links_reviews_title: Really chic, love the oversized fit
links_reviews_text: Wore this over a turtleneck and leggings--thought it was a really cute work look. The blazer is a bit oversized and soft, so it's extremely comfortable. It's also quite long and could probably be worn as a dress when belted!
Great structured blazer that's long and can be worn over skinny jeans or leggings.
Loved the fabric and windowpane details on this blazer! It runs a bit large though.

RENT THIS NOW. Was so flattering and perfect for work and then dinner. Never thought I'd like the robe-tie but it looked great with a turtleneck. Note, it does have shoulder pads, but not too aggressive.

links_reviews_title: Wrinkles too easily. Could not wear.
Was super cute but ran oversized.
links_reviews_text: I like my stuff a little more fitted. This ran large, but I believe that is the intended look. It's a good piece if you like the menswear look!

links_reviews_title: Weird fit - kind of large and kind of small
links_reviews_text: For a 5'4" woman with a larger chest area this did not fit well. It was almost swallowing me but also when I tied it it looked really weird and Bunched around the arms, shoulders and chest.
If you want to feel like a badass, rent this blazer. The shoulders are really padded and give a great silhouette (if you're into that look).

links_reviews_title: Nice blazer, wore it to work with leather leggings and a black tank top like on the model.
links_reviews_text: Nice blazer, comfortable and well made. I rented a small and definitely could have worn an xs. Hard to tell from the pictures but there are shoulder pads that are pretty big.
I liked it okay. It's different
Loved the unique style of this shirt, and the thick material. It's wrap-style so I wore a cami underneath just in case but everything stayed covered up all day. Lots of compliments

This is a semi wrap top, but it leaves a gaping hole that shows your undergarments, so it needs an undershirt for work. The material was about noisy and a cross between a windbreaker and a raincoat. It also ran a bit small, so to tie it and cover your chest it creates a puckering on the other side. Great style, but not practical.

I honestly couldn't figure out how to put this on in a way that would stay put together. The button at the collar wouldn't hold when I tried to tie the closures at my waist and even then, the front flap doesn't connect to anything else but the top button. It was super boxy and smock like. Even with a smaller size, I wouldn't have felt comfortable wearing this to work considering it was one button or tie away from a bad fashion mishap
This top looks classy and fun, adding a bit of joy in what could a plain look. Received many compliments at work!

I admit, I rented this without looking at the fabric in the description. I thought it would be a silk/poly flowing material based on the cut and photos. This had a nylon stiffness - almost windbreaker feel. I wanted to love it, but I just felt it looked crunchy and a bit shiny for my expectations. But unique style and construction - definitely a conversation piece.
Loved this, the color is fantastic... I felt like an avenger. Paired with a black turtleneck and black wedge booties.

links_reviews_title: 5'11 and this jumpsuit didn't give me a camel toe! So cute and easy to wear - loads of compliments
links_reviews_text: Lovely jumpsuit very very easy to wear and I am curvy size 10, 5ft 11 tall girl. I sized up for fear of the length and my rather rotund bum...but I really didn't need to for sure. The jumpsuit was roomy and a little bit stretchy. I wish I could afford to buy it- but this month it was out of budget. Have since added everything Ulla to my hearts.

I LOVED this jumpsuit! I am usually a size 6/8 and I wore the size 6 in this jumpsuit. I would say this jumpsuit runs large because the 6 was still a little baggy on me in the legs but I liked the more oversized look opposed to fitted! You do have to completely undress is go to the bathroom but for the look it is worth it!

I got a variety of responses, although the most frequent was actually: "you look like a Star Wars mechanic" "you can fix my hyper drive". Granted, I work for Marvel so everyone was on-brand. The waist strap is attached, so not optional. The closure is all the buttons you see in the front, so plan your bathroom trips accordingly. I also had to add a tank top because the armpits are cut DEEP. Overall I felt like an absolute badass, people literally step aside when they see this one coming 10/10.

This jumpsuit is super cool. There are tons of seam lines around the garment which was very unique. I'm tall, and I felt the garment fit my torso well. Only complaint was the denim rubbed on my armpits and irritated it end of the day.

links_reviews_title: Lots of buttons with small button holes.
links_reviews_text: Impractical for quarantine-wear due to the time it takes to button/unbutton.
This dress fit great and was super fun and easy to wear. I loved how it looked with my white sneakers but it would also be adorable with sandals!

There is so much I love about this dress and a couple of things I don't. To make it look cute on me the cinching in the waist needed to go up kind of high making it really short in the front. The waist was also a little itchy but I found the more I wore it the more I loved this dress. It was still a little too short for me to wear out and sizing up would be too big.

links_reviews_title: I didn't care for this much , but my husband really liked it !
links_reviews_text: Personally, I thought this looked more like pajamas or a candy striper uniform than something I could confidently wear in the world. Interesting , my husband who rarely has a reaction to my clothes, REALLY liked this dress and asked me to keep it.

I loved this dress. Wore during the COVID-19 pandemic all over my house as well as on walks with my dog and to the grocery store. I wore it for homemade dinner with the husband as well. So comfortable! Looks great with tights or bare legs. I literally wore 5 times in about a week and a half before I sent it back. Also the color looks nice on Zoom!
No good
This was super cute but it is much more cropped than the photo. It is also super heavy so it needs to be pretty cold out to wear it.
This was okay. It makes you looks a bit chunky since the neck is so big. The shoulders are also a little weird in terms of how they fit.

links_reviews_title: I could not get it over my head.
links_reviews_text: Super short and hard to wear.

links_reviews_title: It was a nice style, with the shoulders being both a different color and texture than the rest
links_reviews_text: Fit was a bit boxy, and unfortunately this did not 'wear' well. You could tell it had been rented a lot, from just pulling and fuzz.
Could be casual or dressed up!
With such structured shoulders, it makes people like me (with already broad shoulders), look even wider, not flattering at all. Tried on and returned. However might look better on a smaller frame!

links_reviews_title: It came dirty. I couldn't wear it.
links_reviews_text: It came dirty.

I wore this sweater to work yesterday. It was 5 degrees in Pennsylvania and the thick wool mixed sweater definitely kept me warm all day. The only thing is I am busty it didn't fit like the model. I think next time I will sized up and order a large. I also have broad shoulders. Overall, I loved it and will be wearing it a few more times before I return it.

True to size. I'm a 36B and size 10. The L gave me the right amount of looseness and boxy fit. I wore this three times and would have kept it except RTR can dry clean it for me! It's a warm sweater and with a camisole underneath, it was warm enough for Upstate NY winter. I will rent this again and again and again.
Not particularly flattering. The sleeves did a strange thing when I raised my arms.
The navy cord fabric is almost like a rope. Looks expensive and like that component, but it was much too cropped for me to wear without high-waisted pants. Pretty bulky, too.
Cute on the rack but the shoulders made me look a bit like a linebacker.
Received a lot of complements! Can't go wrong with this jumpsuit

Loved this jumpsuit! I got tons of compliments on it. It's so comfy it feels like you're wearing pj's! Two negatives. It's hard to get on and off and the belt is not removable. I wanted to change the belt and use something a little cooler but the fabric one is sewn on.

Well made and enjoyed wearing. Cute pattern and wore regular bra. Had a bit of trouble getting out of it to use the restroom; however, that's to be expected. I think would look better on someone taller as the length hit me just above ankles. The tie from previous wear was folded over and I couldn't get it to lay flat.
Loved this jumpsuit so so much! It was really comfortable and a great length for short people like myself. I wore it to an all day event and it was easy to get in and out of. Highly recommend
This outfit is so easy and comfortable! I received so many compliments at work. The only issue is using the restroom.

Got so so many compliments on this! Struggled with what shoes to wear but went with the white boots and loved it! It is so soft and comfy. I'm normally a medium but I'm tall so rented the large to make sure it wasn't too short in the torso. LOVED

links_reviews_title: PJ like jumpsuit that is super comfy
links_reviews_text: Love. Felt like silk pajamas. Elastic waistband wit stretch. Only issue - pant length is a little short which makes shoe choice awkward.

Huge fan of the color and print. I realized afterwards I looked a little bloated in my event photos but probably ate tooo much! The lining on this jumper is HEAVENLY SOFT! It's so comfortable. Does not fully button up but is appropriate and not too busty.

This was a perfect work-at-home comfortable yet professional outfit. It felt like I was wearing pajamas but looked great on work video conferencing calls. I would rent this again to wear in an actual office too!

links_reviews_title: Loved it! Would definitely rent again!
links_reviews_text: The fit was great and the cotton fabric was stretchy and soft

links_reviews_title: Felt like pajamas, but also looked like pajamas
links_reviews_text: This jumpsuit was a great color and pattern, and was comfortable. Several reviewers have noted its pajama-like feel, and I agree! However, the overall look was a little too relaxed for my liking in my office setting. The inside of the jumpsuit's elastic waistband fell awkwardly, so that part didn't feel as relaxed as it should and seems like a design flaw. I wore it the once, won't rent again.

This was a miss for me on many levels. First off I would highly discourage anyone who is tall or has a long torso from renting this jumpsuit. I somehow was able to twist my way into it and then could not get out. I could not get this off by myself no matter how I twisted. My husband had to basically give me a massive wedgie while I hunched my shoulders and he slid it off. 2nd problem was the fabric, dull cotton that made this look like pajamas. Total fail for me.

Ended up wearing this jumpsuit to work, but had to wear heels since it can run a little pajama-like if not styled appropriately! Got a ton of compliments on it! The belt cinches nicely to give you more of a figure. The animal print is bold but the color of the jumpsuit is muted so it's balanced decently.

links_reviews_title: Excellent quality but too pajama like
links_reviews_text: Beautiful. But perhaps I'm too short to make this hang right. Waist was a bit high and overall, looked more like jammies despite being SUPER comfy. 5'2"
this is the closest to wearing pjs to work i've come. also arms and torso are a little short. 15/10 would rent again

Wore this to work on a Friday after a holiday break, and it definitely fit the vibe. I ordered a size up from my normal size due to the reviewers comments, loose fitting but does not appear oversized. Comfortable and cozy fit but love the trendy navy leopard print.

Love this jacket. I am quite petite but my arms are on the longer side and this fit that side very well. I got a 2 and it was a little big in certain areas but I think it still fit really well overall. Pair with jeans for a casual look or nice dress pants for an elevated work look.

I liked this more than I thought! It was a great fit, flattering, and a fun print. The sleeves were a tiny bit long on me but didn't look bad. I wore it during a 12-hour day at the office and was comfortable throughout. I typically prefer longer blazers, but this one won me over!
runs a little short
Comfortable and classic. Great color for spring.
but its too short for work, tight on bust and big on hips .. very ill fitting dress
I was very excited to wear this but as you can see there are some sizing problems! Surprised as VB usually runs small if anything. Sad bc the color and shape are lovely!
I'm a size 4-6, so I'm unsure why exactly a size 10 was sent to me. It's a gorgeous dress and color and a 6 would have fit perfectly-I think? My event was cancelled, so nbd.
This is a very hard dress to pull off if you aren't over 5'8" and extremely elegant. I looked ridiculous. It also runs big.
Way too big. Size down.
Liked these more than I thought. High waisted and adjustable at the ankle so you can control how much bunching you want.
couldnt wear 0 for my 24in waist. way to big

links_reviews_title: Wore this out to lunch with friends and during WFH hours
links_reviews_text: Fit as pictured on the model. Balloon-y in the arms and wonderfully placed pockets. Wish I had more time to wear this out of the house, but hopefully such an occasion will come again!

links_reviews_title: Comfy, cute dress - perfect for all day wear!
links_reviews_text: I rented this dress for a work conference. It was perfect because it was comfy and looked cute with dressier sneakers (pictured) as well as mules. I will say, I am usually a 12 and the L fit perfectly, almost too loose.

I usually love Kate Spade , but this dress missed the mark for me. I truly think it's the point of the style to hang and be baggy, but I didn't like it at all on me. Felt like a sack. I wonder if a curvier figure would look much better in it. I'm probably too much of a rectangle shape to pull this off.

links_reviews_title: Made it work sans tie belt!
links_reviews_text: This was a tricky dress to pull off. Same as the other reviewers, I expected it to come with a belt. It didn't, and It looked like a sack of potatoes on me. But I styled it with a clingy knit and a slim belt and it looked fantastic. Oodles of compliments.

I love this dress! It is very flowy and loose. I rented the small and I am usually a size 6. I was surprised this dress has pockets too! The material is very thin. I love the puff in the shoulders and at the wrist cuffs. Received so many compliments!

This dress is made to look oversized, therefore I suggest ordering true to size .... It will give the look you want to achieve in a babydoll style dress. Great transitional piece , it's made of a substantial fabric that's warm and not see through in an any way. I wore this dress to work and received MANY compliments.

links_reviews_title: So cute and comfy with a loose fit!
links_reviews_text: Size down! Pockets are great, super comfy because of flowy nature.
The dress is really cute and well made but it definitely runs really big. I also didn't find the style to be flattering on me so I never wore it.

Cute simple dress, would have been comfortable had it not been so large. I don't mind lose or a little oversized typically but even a belt couldn't get this dress to be undercut or ok. Would consider to rent again a size down for casual work.
I should have ordered a S. I am always a M but this was too big
I liked this dress. Felt comfy and cute. I'm sure it's even better for those who are taller. The sleeves and length were a bit much for me.
Wore to work very roomy
It's perfect for a daily dress for this season. I've got compliments from friends. It goes well with any.
Runs large, too big in the upper body, but a cute dress if you wear a size down.
Great for dress events work whatever! Loved this! The seam near my hips was sorta widening. But I wore with a long sweater jacket and high boots for a warm March day.
Brand new high quality dress. It runs very big and was extremely flowy. I wore a blazer over it to work to tone it down a bit.
I am a size 12 rented a large and could have maybe fit a second human in the bodice of this dress. Size down for sure.
This is a pretty print and my husband complimented me first thing, but's an oversized fit, even more so than I thought from the picture. It certainly was comfortable!

This is a very cute dress but it runs large. The photos show a belt for the waist, but the dress does not come with one. I think this would have looked much cuter with a belt to give some definition - otherwise, it's kind of like a potato sack, but a cute one!

links_reviews_title: Very cute and easy to wear
links_reviews_text: This dress is super cute. There is no zipper so it's a very easy style to wear. Runs true to size. On the photos there is a tie around the waist and mine did not come with the tie. I think it would have looked better with the tie, but it was still cute.
These fit like cheap juniors clothing, so disappointed for the alleged price point. Very nice print but sizing was just so off.

Stylish, high waisted short which can be dressed up or down. Typically wear a size XS in La DoubleJ dresses, but glad to have sized up to S for these shorts. Good for those who like to showcase waist and/or legs.

links_reviews_title: Super well made, hugs waist, flowy skirt
links_reviews_text: Love this skirt! Runs small. Hugs waist so good for crop tops.

links_reviews_title: This skirt is so gorgeous! Perfect length and the pleats do not wrinkle. So comfortable for work!
links_reviews_text: The flowers are more of a creamy gray color. Was a bit hard to find a sweater to match exactly.

links_reviews_title: Sassy but incredibly small in the waist.
links_reviews_text: Great length, pairs easily, flirty..small.

links_reviews_title: Good skirt. A little tight in the waist
links_reviews_text: Comfy flowy!

Such a comfortable skirt!! It wasn't too tight around the waist like some reviews said. It fit me right above the belly button. I wore it with a black long sleeve and a jean jacket during the day and a grey sweater with booties when I went out to dinner. I will definitely be renting again!

This is a great piece for work. I'm 5'2 so it was a bit longer on me, but with heels it works great! It is a bit tight around the waist, but not terrible. I probably wouldn't size up because it might be too loose and long.
wore with a sweater and boots like the model -- super easy to wear, could easily be dressed up. not for windy days tho lol.

This skirt is a lovely print and material, but the waist is very small. I have an hourglass shape and a somewhat small waist, and this would have been right under my bust. Would need to size up next time.
It fit small
I ordered a large based on reviews (am normally a medium) and I still couldn't zipper it all the way.

Great skirt. Great length (hits above the ankles but below mid calf in me, I'm 5'4" and proportionate). Pleats are nice and hide wrinkles well. Waist band is wide (so good) with a hidden zipper, but a little in the small side. I'm pretty slim & fit in my torso (normally an xs/s and it fits but is definitely right on my waist). Still looked good though!

links_reviews_title: Cute flowy skirt for every day!
links_reviews_text: The XS was pretty tight but was fine with a flowy sweater on top. I recommend going TTS with this!
Size up - one or two sizes
The waist on the skirt was very tiny. I would order a size up if you can. It also was rather short on me (but also I know I am taller than most). Could have made it work, but chose not to!

links_reviews_title: Beautiful fabric but the fit is weird
links_reviews_text: This has the potential of being a really gorgeous shirt, the fabric is beautiful but it's way too short to look good with most pants. The buttons are great but it's impossible to get on and off over your hands without having to fumble with three buttons on each sleeve. It also needed a shirt underneath so you weren't constantly worried about flashing everyone. Not my favorite rental, but still made it work for the day.

I was attracted to the interesting print. The fit is nice, although the waist is quite snug and short. It worked well with high waisted black slacks and a black Cami underneath. But in the end, I only wore it once and back it went.
Nice top, but I didn't love it. The fabric at the chest billows and you needs to wear a cami or something because it hangs open. I wish there was a button or a hook.

links_reviews_title: Cute and comfy but definitely meant for a tiny person
links_reviews_text: I wore this for a weekend in D.C. It was very cute and casual. However it did not close over my stomach (I have a bit of a tummy not a toned ab/stomach area). I wore an undershirt because it just didn't fit perfectly and kept riding up into a crop top instead of a shirt. The worst part were the sleeves. I thought I had normal sleeves but clearly you need to have dainty fairy arms and wrists to fit them into the shirt or you have to unbutton the three buttons on the sleeve which is such a hassle. But overall a cute top for the weekend.

links_reviews_title: Very light weight and fun print!
links_reviews_text: I loved this top for a night out but that didn't happen since we are now under shelter in place. Either way, it was a great fit and ran true to size. The button at the bottom made this faux wrap top feel secure and the deep v in the front was very flattering while being modest.
All three buttons were missing from the sleeve. Not sure how this gets missed when it so new back in to be cleaned and inspected. Did not wear. Too bad top was very cute
Great versatile piece. Professional for office or perfect for a relaxed weekend with high waisted jeans.

links_reviews_title: Beautifully made, But I didn't wear it
links_reviews_text: I liked this top but the material was constricting for me to be comfortable in it all day. So I didn't wear i.

I loved the overall look of the top, though it does require a cami or tape to keep from opening in front. A previous review said the waist was small, so I went up a size, but I still found it on the snug side. The top showed up with one button missing from a cuff, but I figured I'd wear it anyway. Unfortunately another button feel off while I was wearing it, which I found quite frustrating. I wish RTR would check to make sure buttons are there and secure before sending as this isn't uncommon.

I was so excited to receive this shirt. The pattern & color & style of the shirt is Beautiful!! Unfortunately, it runs big. This shirt would be great for a more busty chest because of the way it's made, it can definitely accommodate bigger proportions. I received the 10 & would probably need to go down to a 6 or 8. But my concern is that it would be too shirt in torso length.
Pants fit very well and I got lots of compliments! Big win
Did not wear. Funny shape- did not fit me or my daughter. It was too big in the waist for her and felt tight across the middle to me. We both wear size 27 jeans.

links_reviews_title: Well-made, comfortable , runs a little large
links_reviews_text: Iâ€™m 5 ft 6 inches and these were a little longer than would have been most flattering. Would look best imo on a very tall body

links_reviews_title: Super cute leggings. Very stretchy and high waisted. The entire outfit is perfect for WFH
links_reviews_text: Material is very thin and slightly see thru - but as long as you're wearing at home, it's fine!

links_reviews_title: Fun, soft athliesure and on trend!
links_reviews_text: Soft and super comfy. High waisted and cute pattern. I ordered up a size for the length. Otherwise I'm sure they would have been even shorter than in the pic. After wearing they did get kinda baggy in the knees but that may not happen if I would have ordered my regular size. I did NOT exercise in them. So I can't attest to how they hold up there. They were too pretty to get sweaty :)

The style and pattern of these are super cute. Love the tie dye! But that's where the love affair ends. These are thin....like see my underwear even when standing up straight kind of thin. And yes, they fit me and were not too small. If anything, they were a bit large on me. The ankle area is oddly big and baggy. I was wearing these around the house, so it wasn't a huge deal, but I don't think I'd wear these in public due to the thinner fabric and odd fit.

I wore with the matching sweatshirt for a Corona comfy outfit and surprised at how well the pants fit. I am short waisted and can never find a comfy yoga pant and would have bought if the pattern was little more basic. A little too bold for me to do running around.
I wore these several times both with the matching Tory Sport sweatshirt and with other tops. They are very comfortable and easy to wear.

links_reviews_title: Good for lounging not for working out
links_reviews_text: The pants were perfect for around there house and walks in the neighborhood. Anything more vigorous and they slid down.

I actually took these off immediately after putting them on because I thought they were on backward. Nope. Just a very odd fit. I'm lean/curvy, 5'8" 160 and ordered a large. They were so big around the ankle, fitted around thigh, so big in the front and came up low in the back. I'm an 8 in Lululemon leggings so I figured a L in these would work- I really wanted the matching sweatshirt/legging look to work out! I feel like if I had no butt or hips these probably would have fit better
These were so soft and comfy, but too big for me. Slipped down in Pilates. Returning same day. Would rent in smaller sizes.
Nice fabric, great fit. Right touch of stretch.
Great fit and super comfy. I am debating keeping them
I rented this for quarantine fun. I wore it around the house in flip flops but put some heels on for the photo and I can totally see myself wearing this out! Really cute!

I've been really into jumpsuits this quarantine season, and this one was perfect. Made me feel cool but still comfortable. Definitely baggy - I rented my normal size and nowhere was it fitted, but it looked like it does on the model so I believe it was true to size.
I love oversized clothing, but this is on another level and not in a cute way haha. I would say size down 2 sizes if able to. It's a well made item- just sized very strange.

This jumpsuit is the perfect summertime casual staple. The material is breezy but structured in a flattering way. I'm normally a size 2, but if I were to rent this again I'd get the 0. The 2 is flattering and intentionally oversized in the waist and legs, but just a little too much for me. I think the 0 would be perfect!
It was just too big. Might've been cute if it fit.
I should've ordered the 30 as this 31 was slightly baggy, but I could've worn them in a pinch.

The denim material is softer than most. Not stiff or too thick. Good amount of stretch without feeling like I constantly need to pull up on the waist. Love the high rise. I am shorter so they didn't hit at the ankle where I would have liked and I did cuff them a little. If they offered a shorter inseam/petite these would be 5 stars. I probably could have sized down 1 so they were more flattering and fitted at thigh and knee area.

I LOVED these jeans. Unfortunately, I ordered a size too big. If you have sizable thighs, these are for you. The waist was just too big. Nice and high rise though. I am going to Madewell to find some full length, curves, high rise skinny jeans to buy for every day use. I hear they have tall and taller sizes! The only thing I didn't love about these were the length. These came new with tags. So happy I rented them.

These are great jeans with just the right amount of stretch. I would have bought them if they had the tall version available. Madewell jeans are always a tiny bit too short on me but it works for booties season.
True to size
I'm 5'3" and these were down to my ankle bone. Just FYI for those looking for them to fit like the pic.
These were really comfy when I first put them on, however they stretched out a ton with one wear. Also, if you're tall (I'm 5' 10") these were way too short.
They fit great, flattered in the right spots, and were brand spanking new. Tags on and everything, it felt good to pop some tags on my temporary wardrobe!
Loved this! Very comfortable with pockets. Size down, the 0 was roomy on me and I usually wear a 2-4.
Very nice fit, perfect even on my cubby arms, big boobs and over my belly. Light linen fabric-maybe a little much for some offices but perfect for the weekends, summer weddings, or vacation.

links_reviews_title: Compliments!! Felt sexy, classy, and chic.
links_reviews_text: The waist is forgiving. Very comfortable. Linen wrinkles a bit but it kept me cool and it's timeless. It's a little long on me because I'm short but I didn't mind.
Rented for upcoming trip to HI which was postponed due to pandemic. Tried it on and it's cute but as a 5'2 woman it was too long and actually ran a little big. Quality fabric, make and comfortable .
Super fun and flattering
Decent dress for work. Had pockets which was a nice touch. Fit well but was a little long for my height to style for colder weather. Might try again in the summer with some cute sandals
Wore this for a meeting. Cute and flattering. Would rent again
A head-turner for sure. This jumpsuit is absolute magic! Perfect for a date, night out, wedding. So comfy and it accentuates your curves in all the right places.

This jumpsuit is incredibly well made with nice thick fabric. The waistline was very flattering. Unfortunately for me, the torso was way too long (I'm 5'4"). If I could chop off two inches from each shoulder strap, it would have been perfect. However, I had to return it without having worn it.
I wore this both with jeans and to the gym. Comfortable w/ fun colors.

Very cute comfortable sweatshirt. I ordered a medium at first I felt it was going to be too small...but wore it twice so far and it feels fine. Maybe next time I will try the large just for a more oversized comfy feel and more length for the arms...but otherwise M did work out good...I am 5'6 148lbs
Cute comfy light sweatshirt to wear every day. It's a bit short so I either wore with higher waisted pants or put a long tank top u Der. The tie dye design was fun.

links_reviews_title: Lived in this for the weekend I rented it.
links_reviews_text: Tie dye is making a comeback and I'm here for it. This sweatshirt is so comfy and I didn't want to take it off! Fits perfectly and pairs great with leather pants!

This is the prefect sweatshirt - so flattering, slightly boxy and oversized, fun print, and very cozy. I have been living in this sweatshirt since it arrived. I love how the small fits, but probably could have fit in an xsmall for a more fitted look. I really want to keep this one, but I'm struggling to justify spending this much on a sweatshirt! Will definitely keep this sweatshirt around a while though.
Absolutely stunning, wish I could live in it.
Cute and easy. Got compliments all day
Cute skirt! Fun color and very unique for fall. I took off a star bc the faux leather felt very cheap up close, and traps sweat!
This skirt is super super cute! Absolutely great fit in the the waist and hips. However, it was way longer than I anticipated. Wasn't an issue for me but something to consider!
Wore it out to dinner and really liked it! Comfortable and expensive looking. I'd love to plan a really great look around it, but just haven't had the occasion yet. Would rent again!
Cuter in real life than picture. Sized up because 19 weeks pregnant. Got a lot of compliments. High quality!

Tons of compliments. Faux leather is supple and feels as soft as real leather. So many people commented on this skirt. It can be paired with all kinds of boots and tops. It hit me at a midi length. I'm 5'5". It fit true to size but maybe ran a little larger. It is a very forgiving skirt. Doesn't cling.

links_reviews_title: I Loved it! M y husband Loved it! Everyone at work loved it - they even had to do a double take!
links_reviews_text: Pros: Amazing! I will also be packing this for my vacation Cons: None!

links_reviews_title: Beautiful, but looked too large on a petite frame
links_reviews_text: I ordered this in the 2R, and while it did fit in the waist comfortably, it just *looked* big overall. It was too long for me (5'2"), hitting at an unflattering midi-ish length. The color is really beautiful and I love the faux leather look, but this isn't ideal for petite ladies. I'm not sure a smaller size would have resolved those issues, but maybe? This is a faux wrap, so it isn't really adjustable in that way.
Just received this skirt. It's a beautiful color and weight but even wearing it at my natural waist it's still a bit to long for me.

I previously rented the same style in a different color & found the buttons kept pulling open at the chest so rented up one size from my usual and it fit perfectly. The fabric and pattern is even better IRL. It's super long on me so had to wear 5" heels - which I do regularly so not a problem.

Im always excited when a brand offers a size 16 but I find that Nicholas is often small in the bust. I couldn't get this dress to stay buttoned up past my waist. A true bummer as the print is gorgeous. Wrists also felt a little tight for a 16. Disappointing and couldn't wear.

links_reviews_title: Gorgeous but will be long for shorter people
links_reviews_text: This dress is beautiful BUT I'll size up and make sure I'm wearing higher heels when I rent this again. I'm in between sizes 8 and 10 but only 10 was available so I had my work cut out for me. That said, if you're conscious of your belly area like me, size one more up. This is tight around the midsection but a little loose around the chest. It looks fine in this picture but in person, it's not flattering on me. I'm 5'4" and wore 2" heels in this photo and the dress still dragged a smidgen.

The waiste runs really small which was a little problematic. Even when I sized up it just made it bigger everywhere else. I had to wear it opened at the top with a cami under but was frustrated by buttons opening throughout the day. Sad because I really loved it and would have purchased it if it wasnt so hard to wear
It was very slimming.
While the dress is pretty, the buttons are poorly made and are constantly coming open. I wore this to work and it was so bad I went home at lunch and changed

Ugh! The pattern of this dress is cute BUT I couldn't even remotely get it buttoned over my ribcage and chest. The "gap" was INCHES WIDE! I'm usually a 4 or sometimes a 6, but this 6 was so tiny in the ribcage that I couldn't even button it, let alone look good or feel comfortable. I'm not sure if it was defective or if all of them are like this, but I would estimate it was at least 3 sizes too small. Its ridiculous! There's no universe in which a 5'6", 135 pound woman should be a size 12! But I'm guessing that in order for this to fit, that is the size I would have to order. Good luck!
Rented as an 8, then 10, then 12! Success. 8 would have fit except for chest.
This dress was a nice material but the fit was really tight at the waist which made it ride up and gape at the top. Also too low cut for the office; so I ended up not wearing it.

links_reviews_title: Love it, but clings across belly
links_reviews_text: Love this dress, cool material, love the band that sits right under your boobs that keeps it from riding up, and which allows the top to drape correctly. It's a shame I have a hang up about my lower abdomen, and don't like clingy things their, cause otherwise this could be super cute.
Loved the way the seams on this make your body look. So flattering! Very comfortable, too. Got so many compliments.

links_reviews_title: Just enough sparkle for the Opera!
links_reviews_text: Fits tts, waist elastic was a tad tight but still comfortable. Warm and flattering for a late winter day spent walking around NYC.
I liked how this dress sat, it's flattering and comfortable. While a little long and tight in the waist, it worked really well for a day at work.

It was colder than expected for Texas so I threw a leather jacket on top of it. If I weren't such a wuss when it comes to the cold, I'm sure the warmth of it would have been fine! This dress was comfortable, super cute, and I didn't want to take it off! I wish it showed better in photos, but trust me - its a winner!

Dress has sparkle in the thread, so a little much for everyday (for me). Top is loose fitting. I found the waist to be a little tight compared to the rest of the dress. Hoped to wear on New Years but it came late so I didn't wear it.
Once you figure out the elastic waistline it's very flattering perfect with tights/boots and a leather jacket. The tiniest bit of gold thread add a little bit of sparkle but nothing crazy

links_reviews_title: Subtle sparkle, beautiful drape and neckline
links_reviews_text: I really liked this dress. The torso is very long, so it does have that blousy look on top, because the waist is very snug. There's some stretch, but not a ton. The subtle sparkle in this knit is really pretty and makes it just a little extra special. I liked the length on me at 5'2", and the asymmetrical hem is fun. What I especially love is the back neckline, which I didn't get a pick of. It looks elegant and unique coming low in a V, but I was able to wear a regular bra. Great party dress.

links_reviews_title: Skirt angle is a fun add
links_reviews_text: Slightly small in the waist. A little sparkle in the fabric. Really fun cut and great dress.

I wore this to speak on a dinner panel and really liked it. It's not too thick a sweater material so wasn't too hot. I fussed around with there to put the waistband and ended up finding it most flattering when the waistband was higher. It is kind of tight across the belly so don't rent if you want to hide your midsection! Ran slightly small (I'm a 0/2 and it fit well but slightly on the small side).

The dress is covered sparkles, which I couldn't tell from the photo. Also, the cinch in the waste is courtesy of an elastic band that prevented the top from laying properly for me; it caused too much fabric to bunch under the arms. The sleeves are also way too long. Overall a weird fit, and a little too glittery to work for a work dress.
Very cute cut, and love the tight waist and makes the top blousy. I was undecided between a small and medium and am glad I got the medium.
Really didn't like this. Waist fit well, even if snug but the top is oddly shaped and makes you look lumpy. I returned this one immediately. Also smelled like BO.

links_reviews_title: Perfect fit, and love the V back detail.
links_reviews_text: This dress is an easy hit. Cozy, not scratchy sweater material with a bit of shine. The asymmetrical hem and V neck in the back are simple yet bold accents that elevate the dress from day to night. Will rent again for an easy, put together look.

I didn't realize this dress was metallic until received it, but that was a pleasant surprise & perfect for the holiday season. I wore it to work & received a ton of compliments. The length is appropriate for my casual work environment & also for winter. I'm currently riding a scooter after breaking my leg and I can happily say the dress is HC-friendly. The only issue I had was that the torso/ shoulder portion was too wide and big for me and often slipped off my shoulders. Otherwise a nice dress.
Not too heavy, not itchy, waist is elastic. I typically a small/2 and the small fit well. Wear a strapless w this. It is supposed to be a touch loose. I really like this dress for winter!

links_reviews_title: Wore this dress backwards...and it was a great idea!
links_reviews_text: Cute dress that has a little glitter thread in it to dress it up a bit. I wore it backwards on accident, but liked both looks!

Dress is so comfortable. I went with a M to make it more fitted at the waist, but could have gone with a L if I wanted a baggier look. The asymmetrical hem and metallic thread woven throughout make this a perfect sweater dress for office or play!
this shirt has shoulder pads - it's so weird! They don't even go all the way to the shoulder seam of the shirt. I guess it gives the shirt structure but who gets a t-shirt for structure?

It weirdly has shoulder pads which don't bother me but may bother people with a small frame! I could have sized down to medium. But it's perfect since I'm WFH till further notice was a big hit on the video conferences

This was so cute and easy to wear! Perfect with high waisted jeans or leggings. It did have funky shoulder pads, but they just gave it a little structure (definitely felt weirder than they looked). Wore this an embarrassing number of times last month...
Cool, comfy top that isn't too cropped but it does have SHOULDER PADS. They make the shirt look more boxy.
I liked the cropped and boxy fit of this. Bonus for the shoulder pads!

I'm a big fan of tie day and loved this top. I unfortunately didn't get to show it off much as I wore at during quarantine but I'll definitely rent it again. There are shoulder pads but I didn't mind them at all!

First of all, really annoyed RTR didn't have any mention of shoulder pads in details. Never Wld have got this. The shoulder pads are sewn in so I can't even remove them. EWWW. Whyyyy does this top even have shoulder pads???!!!
Ok, so it does have shoulder pads but otherwise a very chill shirt!
I wanted to feel cute while I WFH right now but I feel the need to tell everyone that this tee has shoulder pads. I look like a linebacker.

links_reviews_title: Puffed Sleeves Are A Nice Touch
links_reviews_text: Definitely a great addition to my professional wardrobe.

This blazer is as comfortable as your favorite sweatshirt yet adds polish to any outfit. Wear with a silk blouse, stretchy black pants, and ballet flats for a comfortable conference outfit or with a tee, jeans, and loafers for travel days. The XS was a bit snug so I plan to exchange for a S and will likely purchase it.

links_reviews_title: Great knit blazer. Nice cut and fit.
links_reviews_text: Fit great, gave great shape. Super comfortable knit material. It's basically a sweater shaped like a blazer. Structured and cut really well.

links_reviews_title: Great jacket, it has stretch to it and can be worn casually.
links_reviews_text: Great jacket, it has stretch to it and can be worn casually.

During quarantine it's not easy to keep those work routines like - getting dressed! RTR has kept me in the game with this blouse. Fine fabric, bold color and a little ruffle. Surprising tiny shoulder pads give an edge to this refined look. Very delicate fabric feels luxurious and wrinkles easily - but who cares when only the bust up shows? It's slipper socks and sexy tops for this 9-5 work from home!
I loved this blouse and got many compliments. Great for Zoom meetings!

Loved this top, super cute. It was a little big in me so I tucked it into my jeans to gather the extra material. On the hanger it looked like it would be low on the chest but it wasn't too bad. Very thin and light, love the ruffle details around the neck and cuffs. Would rent again but in the XS.
The red pattern is eye catching and I love the ruffle details. I wore it with my suit for work and casually with high waisted jeans. The cuff are slim, but for perfect on my medium sized wrists.

I made myself wear this on days I didn't need to dress up, just to feel normal! I walked the dog on a warm day, I wore it for a work call, I wore it do dinner (in my dining room), and every time someone complimented it. Even if it was just my 5yo daughter!
Sizing is weird. Neckline had weird fit. Body was wide and length was short. I have a short torso and it was short on me. Sent it back unworn.
This was a really nice blouse. Pretty and light fabric with nice detail. I'd definitely rent this again.
I loved this color and felt very feminine. I got several compliments from my coworkers. It does have shoulder pads but they are not overwhelming, even for petites.

Like this too, cute option for Valentine's Day and a nice vivid red color. The shirt has buttons on sleeve cuffs and one kept coming unbuttoned throughout the day when I wore it which was annoying. Overall a good rental. Perfect tasteful v-neck, professional but fun.
This was such a cute and feminine blouse. I love the ruffle detail and the small shoulder pads. I received lots of compliments and loved how I felt in it.
I was surprised to find that this shirt has shoulder pads. Made the upper arm area a bit tight.

Love B&H - the neckline is beautiful and the color and print were gorgeous. Medium wasn't available, but the large was fine - slightly big but wearable. I did have to steam it a few times, because it wrinkled easily. Would rent this again.

I loved everything about this top. The color is very flattering. It was chic and the floral was nice and bright but not in your face. The sizing ran a little big but since I used it for casual wear I didn't mind too much. I got tons of compliments. Will definitely rent again!

links_reviews_title: Beautiful gold/copper kind of color Junpsuit!
links_reviews_text: I loved this jumpsuit. I normally wear a 10 but wanted this in a confier size so I ordered a 12 and it was a little big but still worked for me for the look I intended.
The fabric is beautiful. This runs big. Size down.
I couldn't get past the bad fit and the horrendous static cling! I could even try to wear it. It was stuck to me from every direction. Hard to see this being flattering even without.

This jumpsuit is super light weight and comfortable. Definitely runs a bit large, and the belt it comes with doesn't stay tight for very long. The color is a little weird - depending on the light can look greenish versus a mustard, but I loved it for a WFH during quarantine look!!
So simple yet so cute! A little big on the top (I have a small torso) but wore a scarf so it was a little hidden
Omg 5'10 so always worried abt jumpsuits being too short (shoulder to crotch that is), this one was a perfect fit! Great color and light silky material. Overall amazing! Almost bought it.

links_reviews_title: This was a fun fashionista wear
links_reviews_text: Normally I wear a size 8 but I was at the store and intrigued by this garment and loved it! This is way I love rtr because I have adjusted my taste to liking larger clothing that is super comfortable and the number of the size matters less.

links_reviews_title: I enjoyed the print of this jumper but the static cling was unbearable.

links_reviews_text: This is a super comfy onesie and perfect for quarantine time. The silk is luxurious - but it's also SILK so I'd never be able to own this romper without wrecking it. Def will be a repeat rental!
Gorgeous , silky . Love it but it runs big . Needed size 6

links_reviews_title: Liked a lot- except the static cling
links_reviews_text: I love a good jumpsuit and this one is great. The color is more green chartreuse- not mustard yellow ochre. The static cling is a problem. I think the plastic bags silky items arrive in is part of the problem. Do we need all of those plastic bags? Invest in some dryer sheets and static cling spray.

links_reviews_title: The jumpsuit to end all jumpsuits
links_reviews_text: I think I'll hold onto this for a while. This jumpsuit is everything: comfortable, perfectly cut with interesting details, soft, low cut without being too low cut... I'm in love. Go with your regular size.

Relaxed fit and great pleating details made this an elegant and elevated jumpsuit. Wore it around the house and my kids told me I looked like a tae kwon do princess. :) Shoes could range from sandals to heels, looked cute with both. I never got to wear it out, but it was the fanciest (and most comfortable) WFH outfit. Just a word of caution - there is no lining and the material is very thin, so nude underwear is a must.

links_reviews_title: Great fabric cute size down top large
links_reviews_text: Awesome jumpsuit, perfect fabric would size down as top is too large and belt had to be pulled in too much but fine for quarantine lol. Really though great jumpsuit with wonderful fabric and nice fit just odd top very low cut
Great work/everyday option. Fit true to size, rounded hemline great for a front tuck.

links_reviews_title: Chic blouse, loved the fun sleeves!
links_reviews_text: Wore this to work and for fun. Loved it! The keyhole open in the back is slightly lower than usual- almost showed my bra strap - but all in all I loved it. Slightly big on me since I'm closer to a 10 but it didn't look slouchy, even a little loose.

Really liked this shirt. The pattern and sleeves are very cute. I feel like it runs a bit big & long as you can see it's kinda loose (I did tucked it in for work & it was perfect). The fabric wrinkles kind of easily since I had it tucked in. The sleeves aren't too overwhelming which is great. I can see myself renting this w/unlimited over and over.

It was a simple style that could dress up or down. The fabric wrinkled fairly easily-- so it was more casual than I would have guessed. But that is part of what made it so versatile. I am a solid size "medium" and this one was a bit big.
Well made shirt and I loved the length. Can dress up for work or wear casual. With all that said, it's nothing I would right home about.

This is a GREAT work blouse, and can be dressed down with jeans as well. Mine came missing a button on the arm but it's so darn cute I pinned it and wore it anyway. It does dip low in the back so a cute bralette is in order here!
I rented this for work, but never wore it as it fit everywhere except the busy and the arm ruffles looked awkward on.
Just ok. Sending back. Wore once to work under a jacket because the button hole in the back was too revealing.
Perfect to wear for work and happy hour. Fit is beautiful. Got lots of compliments.
This is such a cute top. Versatile.
I wear a Medium, sometimes Large in tops & went with the medium. It fits great and is really pretty, have had a lot of compliments. Love the sleeves. For reference I'm 5'8" with a 36C chest.
Loved it! Lots of comments and compliments. Size up one!

The cut of the dress is unique and so cute. Idk if I've put on quarantine weight but it's right around the tummy and breast area. It will fit you well if you're on the smaller chest size. The skirt is also a little short and will continue to rise up but overall on camera it's a gorgeous color and stunning fit. I would keep this if I could afford it!
Really great dress. Good fit, nice material And it arrived brand new with tags.

links_reviews_title: Great color and shape but a little tight
links_reviews_text: Got tons of compliments on this dress and a fabulous heavy fabric! Would rent again but the arm and chest across the top is definitely a little tight. I'm normally a 12 and I sized up because Black Halo. Thought this would be a little big but actually fit pretty much everywhere except that I couldn't lift my arms up.
Strange fit. Tight around chest but goofy in the shoulders. One of the more disappointing rentals b/c i did love the color

links_reviews_title: I loved the high quality material! This one even came with tags on it. Color was beautiful.
links_reviews_text: Unfortunately I could never zip it up in the back. I have a large bust and this dress runs really small especially in the upper chest area.

links_reviews_title: Way too short. Did not wear.
links_reviews_text: Beautifully made, good quality and design.

links_reviews_title: Liked it but didn't wear it.
links_reviews_text: Loved the color and the fabric. It fits tight across the back and it was too short to wear to work. I wanted to like it but just couldn't quite make it work.
Kind of a weird cut across the bodice and arms- will be tight if you have toned or larger arms and need to type all day!
It was tight in the hips, and outlined my stomach a lot. I didn't wear it.
I could only pull this off with high waisted jeans.
Very light weight, wore with cami; sized up to large, medium arm length just fit for tall frame, large comfortably ample.

links_reviews_title: Super cute for work or weekends
links_reviews_text: Easy to wear with jeans and heels or dress pants. Business casual or a fun night out with cute accessories. Got lots of compliments. If you are wearing professionally I recommend high waisted pants or a top underneath if they're not high waisted. It's on the shorter side in front with the tie.
Super cozy yet very stylish. Fits true to size, will rent again.
Loved it

This was adorable - wore it several times. Middle section is a soft sweatshirt material and sleeves are more like a linen/cotton. It actually was pretty warm! I wore it with jeans and a jean skirt and it fit very well but would even consider sizing down.
Really cute top! I wore it to my sons lacrosse game and I looked chic but casual. It is so comfy with a really soft inside!
Didn't end up wearing this because it was small yet boxy on my figure.

I could have sizes down to an XS there seemed to be a lot of extra fabric around the crotch. The belt was broken when I received it so maybe that contributed to the larger feel as I couldn't properly tighten and clasp it
I needed nice black pants for a baptism party and didn't want to go with a plain straight leg. These were great! Nice fabric, great fit, and a cool wide leg fit. Will rent again
I didn't get to wear to work b/c it was too long to wear with flats (can't wear heels atm). HOWEVER, I can't wait to rent again and wear with a nice winter bootie. SO cute.
Love love love these pants. The cinched waist was really flattering. You can dress these up or dress them down as I did. I was surprised by the material - they were a cotton texture. Will rent again!
I'm short with a mommy pouch and was pretty sure I'd never get high waisted pants to work n my body - these did! Fabric is a little thin for winter but otherwise I love them.

links_reviews_title: Loved these for dress up or down
links_reviews_text: I would've given these 5 stars but the only thing is they run a little short in the crotch for tall girls. I'm 5'7 and the length was great.
I loved the fit of these. Seriously considering buying

Normally I hate elastic waistbands on high waisted pants because of the weird poof they make around the stomach, but these worked out so well! The belt is a part of the pants and they give you slight control on how tights you want them, but not much. The belt is mostly for show. I would rent again.
No
Absolutely loved these pants. They are super flattering and weren't too short for my 5'11" long legs.
weird fit, thin fabric
a little long but otherwise great

I was really worried about these fitting right, I have hips but my hips are kinda.., well, square, and pants like these typically do not suit me. The blessing I received when I slid these paper sack pants on... I'm pretty sure angels started singing! Very classy and flattering! Wish I had a picture to share, I might have to buy these! My measurements 41-33-41

links_reviews_title: Loved them so much I bought them!
links_reviews_text: I have historically struggled to find great fitting work pants (pear shape struggles). These are a dream! Small fits me perfectly, as long as I wear them with heels. For reference, I have a 27" waist and 39.5" hips.
Pants fit big. Received compliments when I paired the pants with a trendy jacket and spaghetti strap silk top underneath.
I loved these pants!! They are super flattering and comfortable. I wore these to work, to dinners, going out. It goes with everything!
Love these high waisted paper bag style pants. They were super flattering and fun! Wore them 3 times and only sent back so I could open a spot for a weekend getaway ;-)

links_reviews_title: The pants looked great! I recommend going a size up. They are pretty long but work for tall people.
links_reviews_text: Fun pants
Even with heels, pants dragged on the ground. Must be made for supernaturally tall women
Didn't want to return them, they are so flattering and I got a ton of compliments. Waist a little tight but size so well fitted for petite in the length.

links_reviews_title: Just too short even for petite
links_reviews_text: I'm 5' 3" and it hits like right at the ankle and looked weird with boots or heels. The belt buckle was broken too. It was super cute just too short.
These were cute ankle-hitting flare slacks. The belt and detail are super adorable and the material is comfortable. Nice change up to black slacks

I LOVE these pants. The high waisted is fitted with paper-bag style pleats in front and back, an adjustable belt buckle and full hip. They are very complimentary to my hourglass figure. The length is perfect to style with heels or booties. Excellent for work, for evening dressed up with a sparkly sweater, or my favorite, dressed down with a Ramones t-shirt and Converse! I love them so much that I purchased them. Thank you, Sweet Baby Jamie and RTR!
I'm 5ft 2 and the length with low heels was perfect

links_reviews_title: The Large is about a size 8. Runs small.
links_reviews_text: These are very cute but run small. A large feels like a size 8.
Flattering pants. Wear a fitted shirt for the most flattering look.

Would have given 5+ stars as very comfortable and chic- tons of compliments at work and I felt great wearing them all day. I have a small waist but larger hips and thighs, and this cut was perfect for me. But I styled with a cream top, tucked in at the waist (similar to the photos on the RTR site) and the black dye came off on my top all along the waist line, pretty much immediately. Maybe because they are new, but I would not expect that from well-made clothing.

links_reviews_title: Cute but size up if you have a booty
links_reviews_text: I have a rather small waist compared to my hips and butt. If I sized up it would have been way to loose around my waist but the pant are super cute
The pants have potential. The sizing is small and the material isn't as nice as I expected. But I could see that if the pant fit correctly they could be cute.

links_reviews_title: very cute outfit but runs very small
links_reviews_text: great belt

links_reviews_title: Tooooo TINY !! Is the sizing wrong ??
links_reviews_text: I normally wear size 12 in pants. This size 12 was ridiculously tiny ! They could have been an 8 or a small 10. Huge disappointment. I wish they had been sized correctly because the fabric is truly beautiful. They were new with tags - and I was prepared to purchase. Back they go !! I would have given 5 stars for the quality. I gave 4 stars for the improper sizing. This size 12 was so tiny, I do not see how a 14 could possibly work for me. (I have actually lost a little weight - I checked !). No photos! Impossible to zip!

I'm short and these are the first pants I have had that I didn't need to alter in some way. Super cute. Made my booty look great. The only bad thing....NO POCKETS. If you are a fan of pockets beware. #cutebootypants

The color, fabric, and quality of these shorts are amazing. The color is so vibrant and beautiful and they are so well made. Just be sure to size down by a lot. I have big hips (40+ inches) so I usually size up to a medium in bottoms. We compared and these are bigger than shorts my 6ft husband wears!! (In both length and waist) I am planning on ordering the set in extra small in the future because they are just beautiful

links_reviews_title: Classy just because or work shirt
links_reviews_text: Very impressed with overall fit. I wore with jeans for a work from home situation- but this could have easily been dressed up or dressed down. The flow was perfect and sit nicely for video conference call. Felt professional and sexy all day :)

links_reviews_title: Flawless and versatile top. Loved it for our anniversary celebration!
links_reviews_text: I really liked this top! Details to note: - I said true to size, though it might run a little large. Go with your true size. If you can't, size down NOT up. - This sweater is a full wrap opening. I wore a cami underneath. Pros: - Heavy, quality fabric/feel + soft - Drapes well/falls in shape well + forgiving/flattering - Slimming - Fun + easy to style - goes with everything! - Casual yet can be dressed up Cons: - None truly. But if I had to try: - This was a little big. A little weighty

links_reviews_title: Unique style and great to dress up or down!
links_reviews_text: I loved this sweater and it's unique shape, along with yarn. It is heavier weight so keep that in mind but the sleeveless aspect keeps you cool. Also, the wrap is a true wrap but doesn't fly open& I felt comfortable without wearing anything under it. I think I'm going to rent the Large to see how it compares because at times I felt the XL was too big and other times it didn't bother me (depending on the outfit).

links_reviews_title: Loved it so much I bought it!
links_reviews_text: Heavy material but just right for cold days outside and working inside. I think I'll wear this all the time - goes with everything.
I liked it.

links_reviews_title: Wore this with a statement jacket for a day around the city
links_reviews_text: I wore this with a light wash pair of jeans and a statement cheetah print coat for a nice fall day around the city. It's such a versatile top I love it!

links_reviews_title: Comfortable, good for work or play

links_reviews_text: Such a cool form in that it's technically open in the front. It's great for cool fall days of you run hot in traditional sweaters.

links_reviews_title: Gorgeous!! A bit big and got pretty warm
links_reviews_text: This is a very heavy quality sweater. It was a bit hot the day I wore it. Wait for true fall. It runs large. I will size down next time.

links_reviews_title: Cute in Concept; Fine in Reality
links_reviews_text: I couldn't quite get this to look how I wanted it to. It looked fine but in my head it was going to be great. I think if I rented it again I would actually size up and go for more of an oversized look.

links_reviews_title: was not flattering on me, did not wear
links_reviews_text: not good fit on me

I have to believe this top is made for stick-straight body types. When I put it on, my chest pushed the shirt out so much I looked like I had a soft, billowy paper bag on. If you don't mind losing all the shape of your upper half, this is a good choice.

links_reviews_title: Super versatile and flattering - I really just need to buy this top!
links_reviews_text: I love how versatile the top is in color and design.

links_reviews_title: Was cute on. Wore it multiple times.
links_reviews_text: Love the sweater.
Liked this seater a lot. It's heavyweight but too big on me. Should have ordered the large or even medium. The overlay makes this beyond your basic turtleneck sweater.

links_reviews_title: loved this under a jean jacket or with a black turtleneck underneath
links_reviews_text: true to size, but if you like a bigger fit, then size up
